snippet: Facebook is expected to introduce a Facebook-centric phone on Thursday that is intended to help increase its profit overseas.
abstract: Facebook is expected to introduce Facebook-centric phone powered by Google's Android system that is intended to help increase its profit overseas; moderately priced phone has new search tool that encourages users to use their Facebook friend network, and news feed remade for mobile devices.

headline.main: Facebook Is Expected to Introduce Its Phone
headline.print_headline: Facebook Is Expected To Introduce Its Phone

snippet: A smartphone is a depository of personal information. Here are measures you can take to protect your privacy if your phone is lost or stolen.
abstract: Tool Kit column describes measures and apps that protect personal data on a smartphone if it is lost or stolen

headline.main: How to Shield Yourself From Smartphone Snoops
headline.print_headline: How to Shield Yourself From Smartphone Snoops

snippet: Mobile advertising is beginning to grow rapidly, but are marketers throwing their dollars away? Audience measurement and targeting is far more primitive with mobile apps than on the Web. Mobilewalla, a Seattle-based start-up, has an innovative dat...
abstract: Mobile advertising is beginning to grow rapidly, but are marketers throwing their dollars away? Audience measurement and targeting is far more primitive with mobile apps than on the Web. Mobilewalla, a Seattle-based start-up, has an innovative data-intensive approach to tackling the mobile ad challenge.

headline.main: A Big Data Weapon for the Mobile Ad Challenge
headline.print_headline: Mining the Value Of Mobile Ads

snippet: Several popular browsers can keep open Web pages in sync across computers and mobile devices.
abstract: Several popular browsers can keep open Web pages in sync across computers and mobile devices.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Keeping Web Browsers in Sync

snippet: Twitter, Facebook and other sites are now legitimate ways for chief executives to communicate with investors, but within certain limits. | Two hedge funds waging proxy battles are planning to pay their director nominees as if they were chief execu...
abstract: Twitter, Facebook and other sites are now legitimate ways for chief executives to communicate with investors, but within certain limits. | Two hedge funds waging proxy battles are planning to pay their director nominees as if they were chief executives. | In board rooms in fields like law, technology and private equity, women are still underrepresented. | Verizon quiets talk of a deal.

snippet: In a sign of dissatisfaction at the troubled retail chain, the board of J.C. Penney gave Ron Johnson and other top executives no cash bonuses for 2012.
abstract: J C Penney board of directors slashes pay of chief executive Ron Johnson by almost 97 percent, to $1.9 million, for 2012, clear sign of dissatisfaction over direction of troubled company.

headline.main: J.C. Penney Slashes Pay of Its Chief
headline.print_headline: J.C. Penney Slashes Pay Of Its Chief

snippet: On land not cleared since the Civil War, the maple syrup flows and a dream takes root.
abstract: Robb Turner turned his Duchess County, NY, land into the largest maple syrup production facility in North America and he has created excitement about a sugaring industry in a state that has long struggled to grow one, despite its high concentration of maple trees; Turner is leading a drive to convince chefs and consumers that maple syrup is more than something to pour on pancakes, as can be seen in recipe for maple syrup flavored old-fashioned.

headline.main: Is It Too Classy for Pancakes?
headline.print_headline: Is It Too Classy for Pancakes?
